intro: Argythamnia gracilis, commonly known as the slender sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its linear, grass-like leaves and small yellow flowers make it a distinctive feature of its habitat. Argythamnia gracilis plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing forage for desert wildlife.
